articleContent.title: Chord: Minor 7th in F (Shape: E)
articleContent.content:
# Chord: Minor 7th in F (Shape: E)

## Brief Overview:
The Minor 7th chord in the key of F, played in the shape of an E chord on the guitar, consists of the notes F, Ab, C, and Eb. It is a versatile chord that adds a jazzy and melancholic flavor to music. This chord is widely used in jazz, R&B, and neo-soul styles to create a mellow and introspective atmosphere.

## Notes and Intervals:
- F - Root Note
- Ab - Minor 3rd
- C - Perfect 5th
- Eb - Minor 7th

## Genre and Musical Flavor:
The Minor 7th chord in F (Shape: E) is commonly used in genres like jazz, R&B, and neo-soul. Its melancholic and introspective sound quality adds depth and emotion to these musical styles. This chord is often utilized in ballads, slow jams, and emotional compositions to create a smooth and soulful atmosphere.

## Example Songs:
Here are three songs that prominently feature the Minor 7th chord in F (Shape: E):

1. **"Summertime" by George Gershwin:** This jazz standard features the Minor 7th chord in F (Shape: E) in various progressions, adding a bluesy and sophisticated touch to the song.

2. **"Ribbon In The Sky" by Stevie Wonder:** Stevie Wonder incorporates the Minor 7th chord in F (Shape: E) in this R&B ballad, enhancing the heartfelt and romantic feel of the music.

3. **"Don't Know Why" by Norah Jones:** In this neo-soul infused pop song, the Minor 7th chord in F (Shape: E) is used to create a soulful and introspective vibe, complementing Norah Jones' soothing vocals.
